DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the reason the dose of an agent associated with isolated limb infusion (ILI) or isolated limb perfusion (ILP) was changed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reason for the modification of a dose of agent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.:Modification; the act of making something different.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
Modification; the act of making something different.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.: The act of assessing a situation or event.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.
The act of assessing a situation or event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.: The weight of a subject.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
The weight of a subject.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A loss of feeling or awareness caused by drugs or other substances. Anesthesia keeps patients from feeling pain during surgery or other procedures. Local anesthesia is a loss of feeling in one small area of the body. Regional anesthesia is a loss of feeling in a part of the body, such as an arm or leg. General anesthesia is a loss of feeling and a complete loss of awareness that feels like a very deep sleep.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with a pharmacological substance that produces a loss of feeling.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream.: Bathing an organ or tissue with a fluid. In regional perfusion, a specific area of the body (usually an arm or a leg) receives high doses of anticancer drugs through a blood vessel. Such a procedure is performed to treat cancer that has not spread.: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

The process of flooding fluid through the artery to saturate the surrounding tissue. In regional perfusion, a specific area of the body (usually an arm or a leg) is targeted and high doses of anticancer drugs are flooded through the artery to reach the surrounding tissue and kill as many cancer cells as possible. Such a procedure is performed in cases where the cancer is not thought to have spread past a localized area.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Complications related to damage at the vascular access site. Examples include bleeding, formation of hematoma, aneurysm, pseudoaneurysm, or arteriovenous fistula, development of infection, and catheter thrombosis.

Concepts.definition: Complications related to damage at the vascular access site. Examples include bleeding, formation of hematoma, aneurysm, pseudoaneurysm, or arteriovenous fistula, development of infection, and catheter thrombosis.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Change, alteration, or adjustment of a dose specified in a treatment plan or/and administered to a patient.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University melanoma clinical trial
